curriculum.title: The Accuracy Paradox
curriculum.subtitle: Level 1: Binary Classification
curriculum.narrative: A 'Lazy Model' for Diabetes prediction always predicts 'Healthy'. It looks successful, but is it? Audit the model and find the truth.
curriculum.challenge: Calculate the Accuracy and then build a Confusion Matrix to see the Recall for sick patients.

questions.text: What is the Accuracy of this model? (Total correct / Total patients)
questions.feedback: Correct! 8 out of 10 predictions were right. But notice something...

curriculum.title: The Darts Game
curriculum.subtitle: Level 2: Regression Metrics
curriculum.narrative: Predict house prices! See how different ways of measuring error change your perception of performance.
curriculum.challenge: Move the dots to minimize the error. Watch MAE, MSE, and R-Squared update live.

curriculum.title: The Archerâ€™s Range
curriculum.subtitle: Level 3: Bias vs. Variance
curriculum.narrative: A model is like an archer. Too rigid and it misses the target (Bias). Too loose and it's all over the place (Variance).
curriculum.challenge: Find the 'Sweet Spot' by adjusting the Model Complexity slider.

curriculum.title: The Rotation Policy
curriculum.subtitle: Level 4: K-Fold Cross-Validation
curriculum.narrative: Don't trust a single test split. Rotate the testing slice to ensure your model is truly robust.
curriculum.challenge: Simulate the rotation and observe the variance in scores across folds.

knowledge_gates.question: If a model has 100% accuracy on training data but only 60% on test data, what is the problem?
Which metric is most sensitive to outliers?
